content.content:
## Course Project

The goal of this project is to apply everything we learned
in this course and build an end-to-end data pipeline.

You will have two attempts to submit your project. If you don't have 
time to submit your project by the end of attempt #1 (you started the 
course late, you have vacation plans, life/work got in the way, etc.)
or you fail your first attempt, 
then you will have a second chance to submit your project as attempt
#2. 

There are only two attempts.

Remember that to pass the project, you must evaluate 3 peers. If you don't do that,
your project can't be considered complete.

To find the projects assigned to you, use the peer review assignments link 
and find your hash in the first column. You will see three rows: you need to evaluate 
each of these projects. For each project, you need to submit the form once,
so in total, you will make three submissions. 


### Submitting

#### Project Attempt #1

* Project: https://courses.datatalks.club/de-zoomcamp-2024/project/project1
* Review: https://courses.datatalks.club/de-zoomcamp-2024/project/project1/eval

#### Project Attempt #2

* Project: https://courses.datatalks.club/de-zoomcamp-2024/project/project2
* Review: https://courses.datatalks.club/de-zoomcamp-2024/project/project2/eval

> **Important**: update your "Certificate name" here: https://courses.datatalks.club/de-zoomcamp-2024/enrollment -
this is what we will use when generating certificates for you.

### Evaluation criteria

See [here](../../week_7_project/README.md)

### Misc

To get the hash for your project, use this function to hash your email:

```python
from hashlib import sha1

def compute_hash(email):
    return sha1(email.lower().encode('utf-8')).hexdigest()
```

Or use [this website](http://www.sha1-online.com/).

parts.content:
It appears that the search did not return specific details about setting up your Google Cloud Platform (GCP) project specifically for this course. However, I can provide you with a general outline of the steps typically involved in setting up a GCP project:

### Steps to Set Up a GCP Project

1. **Create a Google Cloud Account**:
   - If you don't have a Google Cloud account, go to the [Google Cloud Platform](https://cloud.google.com/) and sign up.

2. **Create a New Project**:
   - Go to the Google Cloud Console.
   - Click on the project drop-down at the top of the page and then click on "New Project".
   - Enter a name for your project and select your organization, if applicable.
   - Click "Create".

3. **Enable Billing**:
   - After creating your project, go to the "Billing" section in the console.
   - Link your project to a billing account to enable usage of GCP services.

4. **Enable Required APIs**:
   - Navigate to the “API & Services” section.
   - Click on “Library” and search for the APIs that you will need (e.g., Google Cloud Storage API, BigQuery API, etc.).
   - Enable those APIs for your project.

5. **Set Up IAM & Permissions**:
   - Go to the "IAM & Admin" section.
   - Set up roles and permissions for yourself and any collaborators you might be working with.

6. **Create Service Accounts (if necessary)**:
   - For applications that need to access other Google Cloud services without user interaction, create a service account.
   - Assign appropriate roles to this service account based on the services it needs to access.

7. **Configure Networking and Security**:
   - Depending on your project's needs, consider configuring Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) settings and security protocols like Firewall rules.

8. **Set Up Resources**:
   - Depending on your course needs, create necessary resources like Cloud Storage buckets, BigQuery datasets, etc.

9. **Obtain Credentials**:
   - If you are using a service account, download the service account key in JSON format for authentication to GCP services.

10. **Testing and Validation**:
    - Test your setup by running a simple query or loading data to ensure that everything is configured correctly.

For more specific instructions or if there are additional elements pertinent to the specific course you are taking, I recommend checking the course materials or the documentation related to the course on GCP project setup.

If you need information on any specific part of this setup, please feel free to ask!
